alert.note: Alert for Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 1:27AM CDT until further notice by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Dimmit, Maverick and Zavala. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1/2 inch are possible over the area through 4 AM CDT. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Indio, Cometa and Farias Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
